enumeratorHelp:
Show the child the sheet of invented words in the student stimuli booklet.
Reminders:
  • Start the timer when the child reads the first word.
  • Touch each incorrect word (it will become blue). Touch again to mark it correct if the child self-corrects.
  • Stay quiet, except when providing answers as follows: if the child hesitates for 3 seconds, provide the word, point to the next word and say “Please go on.”Mark the word you provide to the child as incorrect.
    AFTER 60 SECONDS (the screen will flash red) SAY, “STOP.” Touch the final word read (it will place a red box on the word) - ensure that this word is correctly marked as either correct or incorrect.
    Early stop rule: If the child does not give a single correct response on the first line, say “Thank you!”, Press the [Stop] button and the last word attempted and go on to the next exercise.
studentDialog:
Here are some made-up words. I would like you to read as many as you can. Do not spell the words, but read them. For example, this made-up word is: “ut”.
Let’s practise: Please read this word [point to the next word “dif”]:
  • [If the student says “dif”, say]: Very good, “dif.”
  • If the child does not say “dif” correctly, say: This made up word is “dif”
    Now try another one: Please read this word [point to the next word “mab”]:
  • [If the student says “mab”, say]: Very good, “mab.”
  • If the child does not say “mab” correctly, say: This made up word is “mab”

    When I say “begin,” read the words as quickly and carefully as you can. Read the words across the page, starting at the first row below the line. I will keep quiet and listen to you, unless you need help. Do you understand what you are to do? Ready? Begin.
